data.name: AboutPage_DetailDescription
data.value: Here displays the details about the application,

data.name: AboutPage_FrameworkDescription
data.value: This application is supported by .NET 8 runtime, with Windows App SDK.

data.name: AboutPage_SpecialThanksDescription
data.value: This project uses the following open-source code for references:

data.name: AnalyzePage_AnalysisResultNotExist
data.value: Cannot output analysis because the puzzle has never been analyzed yet.

data.name: AnalyzePage_AreYouSureToReturnToEmpty
data.value: This will clear the puzzle, returning the puzzle to empty state. Are you sure?

data.name: AnalyzePage_BatchGeneratingTipDescription
data.value: Using the predefined strategy to batch generating puzzles, saving them to the specified target place

data.name: AnalyzePage_CannotOpenFile_FileIsEmpty
data.value: The currently chosen file is empty.

data.name: AnalyzePage_CannotOpenFile_FileIsTooLarge
data.value: The currently chosen file is too large - it is oversized.

data.name: AnalyzePage_CannotOpenFile_GridIsInvalidToParse
data.value: The puzzle in the file is invalid to be parsed.

data.name: AnalyzePage_CannotOpenFile_GridIsNotUnique
data.value: The puzzle in the file does not contain a unique solution - it contains multiple solutions, or the puzzle is invalid.

data.name: AnalyzePage_CannotOpenFile_ProgramIsSnapped
data.value: Cannot open the file picker because the current program is snapped, which is disallowed.

data.name: AnalyzePage_ChooseFormats
data.value: Please choose the format that you want to save:

data.name: AnalyzePage_CurrentGridFormatTreatingModifiableAsGiven
data.value: Current grid format, but all values will be treated as givens

data.name: AnalyzePage_DisorderedIttoryuDoesNotExist
data.value: Sorry, this puzzle does not contain a valid disordered ittoryu digit sequence :(

data.name: AnalyzePage_ErrorStepEncountered
data.value: An error step has been encountered, which causes the analyzer module shut down. Please contact author to fix this issue.

data.name: AnalyzePage_FilteringFailedDueToInvalidExpression
data.value: Filtering expression is invalid. Please check.

data.name: AnalyzePage_GenerateComment
data.value: The program uses a simple way to solve a puzzle, so the result is only used for reference.

data.name: AnalyzePage_GenerateForMinimalPuzzleTooltip
data.value: If any one given in a puzzle cannot be removed, the puzzle will be minimal.

data.name: AnalyzePage_MinimalResult_AtLeastOneHintCanBeRemoved
data.value: No (at least one hint can be removed, e.g. {0})

data.name: AnalyzePage_MinimalResult_NotUniquePuzzle
data.value: No (puzzle is not unique, or unfixed)

data.name: AnalyzePage_PuzzleHasUniqueSolutionButUnfixed
data.value: Unique solution, but with grid being unfixed

data.name: AnalyzePage_PuzzleIsInvalid
data.value: Puzzle is invalid. It means it has no solution, or contains multiple solutions, which is invalid case to be checked.

data.name: AnalyzePage_PuzzleIsNotBugMultiple
data.value: This grid is not valid for BUG+n, no true candidates searched.

data.name: AnalyzePage_SearchAllSteps
data.value: Input search expression, e.g. name like '[Uu]nique\sRectangle.*'

data.name: DrawingPage_InputCharacter
data.value: Input character as a baba group:

data.name: DrawingPage_Intro
data.value: This page allows you drawing onto the sudoku grid.

data.name: GeneratingStrategyPage_GivensEnabledMustBePreviousControlSetTrue
data.value: Givens function must be enabled if the previous function is enabled.

data.name: GeneratingStrategyPage_Intro
data.value: This page provides with configured generating strategies used by analyzer page. The puzzle will be generated via the specified strategy displayed in this page.

data.name: GeneratingStrategyPage_IttroyuLengthEnabledMustBeEasy
data.value: Ittroyu function must be enabled if easy difficulty is selected.

data.name: HotkeyCheatTablePage_ClearCellDescription
data.value: That means, the function will clear the cell, making the cell be the empty state. If the cell is a given cell (which means the initial sudoku puzzle uses this cell as a hint), the program will do nothing no matter whether you have triggered the hotkey

data.name: HotkeyCheatTablePage_CopyCurrentGridCode
data.value: Copy code for grid at current state

data.name: HotkeyCheatTablePage_CopyCurrentGridPicture
data.value: Copy picture for grid at current state

data.name: HotkeyCheatTablePage_Description
data.value: This page lists the hotkeys that the functions that the program will use. You can use the following hotkeys to achieve some functions without clicking buttons.

data.name: HotkeyCheatTablePage_SavePuzzleToLocalPath
data.value: Save puzzle to the local path

data.name: LibraryCandidatesVisibility_ShownWhenPuzzleIsGreaterThanModerate
data.value: Shown if cannot be finished by easy & moderate techniques

data.name: LibraryPage_AddOnePuzzleDialogTextCodeIsInvalid
data.value: Text is invalid to be parsed as a grid. Please check and try again.

data.name: LibraryPage_Description
data.value: This page lists your libaries configured. You can click them to check puzzles for such libraries.

data.name: LibraryPage_FileNameIsValidAsFileId
data.value: File name is invalid to be the file name. Please remove invalid characters and try again.

data.name: LibraryPuzzleTransformKinds_MirrorAntidiagonal
data.value: Anti-diagonal mirror (Swap cells from sides related to anti-diagonal)

data.name: LibraryPuzzleTransformKinds_MirrorDiagonal
data.value: Diagonal mirror (Swap cells from sides related to diagonal)

data.name: LibraryPuzzleTransformKinds_MirrowLeftRight
data.value: Left-right mirror (Swap cells from left and right side of the grid)

data.name: LibraryPuzzleTransformKinds_MirrowTopBottom
data.value: Top-bottom mirror (Swap cells from top and bottom side of the grid)

data.name: OcrPage_DescriptionPart1
data.value: This page uses OCR technique to recognize from a picture, and convert it into a valid sudoku puzzle to be used in the current program.

data.name: OcrPage_DescriptionPart2
data.value: This function is experimental one. Please DO NOT rely on it.

data.name: OcrPage_LanguageIsNotSupportedForNow
data.value: Sorry. OCR engine requires some items (e.g. language packages) that may not be supported for your device. You cannot use this engine due to the lack of such APIs.

data.name: SettingsPage_AlignedExclusionMaxSearchingSize
data.value: Maximum number of cell permutation in aligned exclusion

data.name: SettingsPage_AlignedExclusionMaxSearchingSizeDescription
data.value: A value controlling the complexity of searching operation for Aligned Exclusion technique. The maximum possible value is 5, recommend value is 3, and the minimum value is 2. It cannot be negative.

data.name: SettingsPage_AllowedDirectTechniquesDescription
data.value: "Direct Techniques" are techniques that are based on singles, but they will rely on some easy techniques only producing eliminations like Intersection and Subset. This option can make such direct techniques available in direct view mode. Disabled techniques here won't be appeared in the analysis operation.

data.name: SettingsPage_AllowIncompleteUniqueRectangles
data.value: Allow searching for Incomplete Unique Rectangle

data.name: SettingsPage_AllowIrregularWingSubtypesDescription
data.value: The name of the subtypes are "terrible", so I will give you the pattern detail of each subtype. The brace means strong or weak links are produced in cells

data.name: SettingsPage_AlsoDisplayEnglishNameOfTheStep
data.value: Also display English name of the step

data.name: SettingsPage_AlsoSaveBatchGeneratedPuzzlesIntoHistory
data.value: Also saves for batch-generated puzzles into history

data.name: SettingsPage_AnalysisDescription
data.value: This page lists options that controls the analysis and gathering solving steps of a puzzle

data.name: SettingsPage_AutoCachePuzzleAndViewsDescription
data.value: This option will control the behavior of caching puzzles after you switched pages or closed the program. If the program is re-started, launched and analyzer page is displayed, this option will control whether the last puzzle and views should be displayed. This option can fast recover the analyzing environment.

data.name: SettingsPage_AuxiliaryColorsDescription
data.value: Auxiliary colors are used by views, for displaying highlighted elements in a technique step

data.name: SettingsPage_BackdropDescription
data.value: This option is deprecated, meaning you cannot modify for this option because it is no longer supported by Windows. The backdrops will be back if higher versions of Windows application SDK.

data.name: SettingsPage_BasicDescription
data.value: This page lists options that controls the program itself

data.name: SettingsPage_CandidateViewNodeDisplayModeDescription
data.value: This option controls the behavior on displaying a candidate.

data.name: SettingsPage_CheckValueTypes
data.value: Check for Extended Almost Locked Candidates

data.name: SettingsPage_ConceptNotationBasedKindDescription
data.value: This option controls the desired mode for describing a cell, candidate, house and so on using text. "RxCy" is suggested mode.

data.name: SettingsPage_CurrentlySelectedThemeIs
data.value: Hey! Currently you use {0}, so all options related to colors will only display used by {0}. If you want to modify options related to the other theme, please switch to {1} in basic configuration page first.

data.name: SettingsPage_DeltaCandidateColorDescription
data.value: Delta candidates are ones that are incorrect eliminations

data.name: SettingsPage_DeltaCellColorDescription
data.value: Delta cells are digits that are confilct with its same house

data.name: SettingsPage_DifficultyLevelMode
data.value: Behavior on difficulty level of step collector

data.name: SettingsPage_DifficultyLevelModeDescription
data.value: This option controls the behavior which level of steps that a step collector can collect. The more number of steps can be collected, the slower the program will be executed.

data.name: SettingsPage_DirectHiddenSubsetMaxSize
data.value: Max size of Direct Hidden Subsets (including Locked Hidden Subsets)

data.name: SettingsPage_DirectHiddenSubsetMaxSizeDescription
data.value: Same as above, but this option controls with Direct Hidden Subsets. The suggested value is 2, and the maximum value is 4.

data.name: SettingsPage_DirectNakedSubsetMaxSize
data.value: Max size of Direct Naked Subsets (including Locked Subsets and Naked Subsets (+))

data.name: SettingsPage_DirectNakedSubsetMaxSizeDescription
data.value: Sometimes subsets whose size greater than 2 are not "direct". This option can control with this in searching for Direct Naked Subsets. This option only works with direct techniques (mentioned above this option). The suggested value is 2, and the maximum value is 4.

data.name: SettingsPage_DisableFinnedOrSashimiXWing
data.value: Disable for Finned X-Wings & Sashimi X-Wings

data.name: SettingsPage_DisableFinnedOrSashimiXWingDescription
data.value: Grouped & non-grouped Skyscrapers are equivalent to X-Wings, but some users may be used to spotting for skyscrapers and grouped skyscrapers instead of finned or sashimi X-Wings. This option can disable for Finned X-Wings & Sashimi X-Wings.

data.name: SettingsPage_DisableSudokuPaneLayoutDisplaying
data.value: Disable flyout in sudoku pane when right-clicked

data.name: SettingsPage_DisplayCandidatesForPuzzlesDescription
data.value: Due to unknown information of candidate visibility, we cannot determine which kind of candidate displaying case is good. This option gives you some options you can control for this behavior.

data.name: SettingsPage_DisplayCursorsDescription
data.value: Cursors are a group of highlighted cells that describes what cell your cursor point points to.

data.name: SettingsPage_DistinctDirectAndIndirectModesDescription
data.value: This option controls the case whether the program will display candidates. If all candidates are displayed, we can re-order the searching logic (making naked singles before hidden singles) to make the solving and analysis experience better. Hidden subsets will be also re-arranged in this option. However, this option will not take any effect if ittoryu settings are enabled (because ittoryu modes are used in ONLY direct views).

data.name: SettingsPage_DistinctWithDeltaDigitsDescription
data.value: In a puzzle with a unique solution, the program can check whether the digits input (deleted) is correct. If this option is on, the program will use another color to display wrong conclusions.

data.name: SettingsPage_DrawingDescription
data.value: This page lists options that controls the drawing and rendering of sudoku puzzles

data.name: SettingsPage_EmptyCellCharacter
data.value: Placeholder for empty cells in text

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableAnimationFeedbackDescription
data.value: If this option is set true, when you adjust state of the sudoku grid pane, you can see animation (such as candidates ease in/out). Such animations are called "Animation Feedback".

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableCornerRadiusForSudokuPanes
data.value: Enable corner radius property for sudoku panes

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableDoubleTapFillingForSudokuPane
data.value: Enable double tapping to fill digit

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableDoubleTapFillingForSudokuPaneDescription
data.value: If this option is enabled, when you double-clicked a candidate (requiring displaying candidates), the digit can be automatically input into the cell. In addition, some sudoku panels in some pages may not be related to this option because of not displaying of candidates.

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableFullHouseDescription
data.value: If disabled, the technique that uses only one house with only one cell being empty will be treated as naked single

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableRightTapRemovingForSudokuPane
data.value: Enable right tapping to remove digit

data.name: SettingsPage_EnableRightTapRemovingForSudokuPaneDescription
data.value: If this option is enabled, when you right-clicked a candidate (requiring displaying candidates), the digit will be removed from the cell. In additional, some sudoku panels in some pages may not be related to this option because of not displaying of candidates.

data.name: SettingsPage_HiddenSinglesInBlockFirst
data.value: Search for Hidden Single in Block first

data.name: SettingsPage_HighlightedPencilmarkBackgroundEllipseScaleTitle
data.value: Scale of highlighted candidate background circles

data.name: SettingsPage_HouseCompletedFeedbackColorDescription
data.value: When you fill with a digit into a cell, making the containing house be completed, animation feedback will be triggered with a color specified here.

data.name: SettingsPage_HouseNotationOnlyDisplayCapitalsInRxCyNotation
data.value: RxCy Notation - Only output capitals 'r', 'c' and 'b' for houses

data.name: SettingsPage_Intro
data.value: Here lists the preference items that will be used in the program. You can modify and adjust them with a new value to make the program be more suitable to be used. All preference items are saved on-time, however such items require restarting.

data.name: SettingsPage_IttoryuSettingsGroupDescription
data.value: finish all candidate positions of digit 1, and then finish for digit 2s, 3s, 4s and so on.

data.name: SettingsPage_IttoryuSupportedTechniques
data.value: Support techniques to be used via check ittoryu

data.name: SettingsPage_IttoryuSupportedTechniquesDescription
data.value: The current expander displays for techniques which will be used in checking whether a puzzle is an ittoryu puzzle or not. By default, all single techniques will be included: Hidden Singles, Naked Singles and Full Houses. Last Digits will be replaced with Hidden Singles in Block.

data.name: SettingsPage_IttoryuTechnique_HiddenSingleBlock
data.value: Hidden Single in Block (Not suggested for disabled)

data.name: SettingsPage_LanguageDescription
data.value: If you have already changed the language, it will become available in the second time you open this program.

data.name: SettingsPage_LibraryDescription
data.value: This page lists options that controls the preferences for library-related pages.

data.name: SettingsPage_LibraryPuzzleTransformationDescription
data.value: This option controls the case that which way the puzzle fetched from puzzle libraries should be applied in transformation, making some differences with the orginal puzzle.

data.name: SettingsPage_MakeDigitBeforeCellInRxCyNotation
data.value: RxCy Notation - Make digits output left-side cell coordinates

data.name: SettingsPage_MakeLettersUpperCaseInExcelNotation
data.value: Excel Notation - Make upper-casing for coordinate letters

data.name: SettingsPage_MakeLettersUpperCaseInK9Notation
data.value: K9 Notation - Make upper-casing for coordinate letters

data.name: SettingsPage_MakeLettersUpperCaseInRxCyNotation
data.value: RxCy Notation - Make upper-casing for coordinate letters

data.name: SettingsPage_MaxSizeOfComplexFish
data.value: Maximum size of Hobiwan Fish to be searched for

data.name: SettingsPage_MaxSizeOfRegularWing
data.value: Maximum size of Regular Wing to be searched for

data.name: SettingsPage_PictureSizeOnSavingDescription
data.value: A value controlling the result size of the target picture you want to save to local. The greater the value can be, the slower the operation will be executed. The default and recommend value is 1000.

data.name: SettingsPage_PreventConflictingInputDescription
data.value: This option limits the case that user wants to input a digit into a cell, whose containing houses has already include the digit as given or modifiable values. If this option is set true, the program won't allow this case, and do nothing after you input a wrong digit.

data.name: SettingsPage_ReverseBugMaxSearchingEmptyCellsCount
data.value: Maximum number of empty cells searching in Reverse BUG

data.name: SettingsPage_ReverseBugMaxSearchingEmptyCellsCountDescription
data.value: A value controlling the complexity of searching operation for Reverse BUG technique. This maximum possible value is 4, recommend value is 2, and the minimum value is 1. It cannot be negative.

data.name: SettingsPage_SavePuzzleGeneratingHistoryDescription
data.value: If true, when we click "generate" button in the analysis page, the puzzle will be automatically saved into history collection, then if we close the program, the history collection will be output into your comuputer, in "MyDocuments" folder.

data.name: SettingsPage_SearchExtendedBivalueUniversalGraveTypes
data.value: Allow searching for extended types of Bi-value Universal Grave

data.name: SettingsPage_SearchExtendedDeathBlossomTypes
data.value: Allow searching for Complex Death Blossom

data.name: SettingsPage_SearchForExtendedUniqueRectangles
data.value: Allow searching for extended types of Unique Rectangle

data.name: SettingsPage_SearchForReverseBugPartiallyUsedTypes
data.value: Search for partially-used types for Reverse BUG

data.name: SettingsPage_SearchForReverseBugPartiallyUsedTypesDescription
data.value: Reverse BUG techniques may not rely on ALL value cells in a grid. If this option is true, the corresponding step searcher will check for non-fully-used cells, but it will cause a slow searching experience.

data.name: SettingsPage_StepDisplayItemsDescription
data.value: This option controls the tooltip content when you put your cursor onto a technique step.

data.name: SettingsPage_StepSearcherOrderingDescription
data.value: This option controls the ordering of step-searching. For example, if you put "Subsets" before "Locked Candidates", subset-related steps will have a higher priority to be searched. If you disable it, it will be really disabled in step-searching. In addition, we recommend you NOT disable or re-order some important step searchers.

data.name: SettingsPage_StrongLinkDashStyleDescription
data.value: Please input a series of digits, indicating the dash style of a chain link. Digits are the length of all split sub-lines. For example, "3,2" means a dotted line with contain several periods of two sub-lines, with lengths 3 and 2. You can keep the text box be empty, which means the line will not use dotted rule to separate it with multiple parts.

data.name: SettingsPage_TransparentBackgroundDescription
data.value: If this option is true, white background of sudoku pane will not be rendered. This will make the sudoku pane a better look. Please note that saving/copying transparent-background sudoku pane is terrible, so this program offers a rescue that prevents "Empty background" bug, but it may cause a flashing while saving/copying pictures from sudoku pane.

data.name: Settings_DisplayDifficultyRatingForHodokuDescription
data.value: Indicates whether the difficulty rating value defined by HoDoKu will be displayed in the step shown in solving path tab. If the current technique is not defined in HoDoKu, a string "HR" in light white will be displayed as a placeholder

data.name: Settings_DisplayDifficultyRatingForSudokuExplainerDescription
data.value: Indicates whether the difficulty rating value defined by Sudoku Explainer will be displayed in the step shown in solving path tab. If the current technique is not defined in Sudoku Explainer, a string "SER" in light white will be displayed as a placeholder; if HoDoKu rating will be also displayed, Sudoku Explainer rating will be shown right-side of the HoDoKu rating

data.name: SingleCountingPracticingPage_InputPuzzlesCount
data.value: Input the desired number of puzzles to practice:

data.name: SingleCountingPracticingPage_Intro
data.value: This page offers you a sudoku grid to practice techniques "Naked Single" and "Full House". You can get experienced from this page. The puzzle will generate some puzzles and display them one by one, you should input the result inside the sudoku pane. No matter whether your answer is correct, program will go to the next puzzle. When you answer the specified number of puzzles, the game will be automatically over, and calculates the result.

data.name: SingleCountingPracticingPage_ResultDisplayLabel
StepSearcherSorterPage_Description
data.value: Here displays the details of modules that searches for techniques. You can drag any one of the modules mentioned below to modify its priority of the calculation order. Please note that, some technique searchers may not be supported here but they persist being displayed. They won't take any effect.

data.name: TechniqueFeature_DirectTechniques
data.value: This technique only appears in direct view mode, i.e. no candidates displayed.

data.name: TechniqueFeature_HardToBeGenerated
data.value: This technique cannot be generated or extremely hard to be generated.

data.name: TechniqueFeature_NotImplemented
data.value: This technique hasn't be implemented by author. Please wait for implementation with patience.

data.name: TechniqueFeature_OnlyExistInTheory
data.value: This technique can only exist in theory. In practice you may not see them.

data.name: TechniqueFeature_WillBeReplacedByOtherTechnique
data.value: This technique will be replaced with other techniques.

data.name: TechniqueGalleryPage_Intro
data.value: This page lists techniques that the current program are supported, which can help you learn them.

data.name: GeneratedPuzzleConstraintPage_Intro
data.value: This page stores the constraints that will be used in analyze page, filtering generated puzzles automatically. You can control the following rules to filter puzzles.

data.name: GeneratedPuzzleConstraintPage_PrimaryTechniqueLabelPart2
data.value: only, allows for hidden single in lines:

data.name: TechniqueInfoModifierPage_Description
data.value: This page can modify configurations on difficulty level and rating values, in order to be used by step searcher modules.

data.name: TechniqueInfoModifierPage_ScaleValueDescription
data.value: Sets the scale value using by values of technique rating values set in the page. The final rating of the technique equals to the base technique value you set divided by this scale value.

data.name: GeneratedPuzzleConstraintPage_BottleneckStepConstraintPart1
data.value: Bottleneck step rating should be between

data.name: ErrorInfo_GridMustBeSolvedOrNotBad
data.value: The puzzle must be solved or contain at least one valid solution.

data.name: SettingsPage_HiddenSubsetMaxSizeInComplexSingle
data.value: Maximum size of hidden subsets in complex single

data.name: SettingsPage_HiddenSubsetMaxSizeInComplexSingleDescription
data.value: Indicates the maximum size of hidden subset can be used in complex single. The maximum value is 4 and the minimal value is 2.

data.name: SettingsPage_NakedSubsetMaxSizeInComplexSingle
data.value: Maximum size of naked subsets in complex single

data.name: SettingsPage_NakedSubsetMaxSizeInComplexSingleDescription
data.value: Indicates the maximum size of naked subset can be used in complex single. The maximum value is 4 and the minimal value is 2.

data.name: AnalyzePage_SukakuIsNotSupportedForThisFunctionDescription
data.value: This function is not supported for Sukaku puzzles.

data.name: PatternBasedPuzzleGeneratorPage_Description
data.value: This page represents a way to generate a puzzle via user-defined patterns.

data.name: RatingFormulaPage_Intro
data.value: This page displays the formulae that you can configure customized calculation on difficulty ratings with each technique step.

data.name: RatingFormulaPage_BuiltInFormulaeDescription
data.value: If you don't know how to configure such expressions, please visit this to learn more infromation about formulae and how they works.

data.name: RatingFormulaPage_CustomizedFormulaeDescription
data.value: You can use this option to create your own customized formulae to calculate them. This option can also view them.

data.name: RatingFormulaPage_FunctionsDefinedDescription
data.value: This option stores extra functions that can be called by the formulae defined above.
